intro: Malesherbia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered malesherbia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
